p: More recently, based on the properties presented in the previous chapters, natural products obtained from S. hortensis found application in meat industry [ 28], food antimicrobials [ 81], food packaging [ 21] and fresh vegetables preservation [ 82]. Thus, due to its high content in antimicrobial and antioxidant compounds (such as carvacrol, p-cymene and thymol), SHEO could offer an alternative for increasing the shelf life of meat products or vegetables [ 81, 82, 83, 84]. Although the essential oil in general (and SHEO in particular) are extensively studied for different activities, due to their characteristics (volatility, thermal decomposition, unstable nature), they should be incorporated in different matrixes for topical applications, as presented in previous chapters [ 20, 21, 31, 56, 57, 82, 83, 84].
